/instances.description: Provides operations to manage the instances property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewScheduleDefinition entity.

get.description: Get a list of the accessReviewInstance objects and their properties.

post.summary: Create new navigation property to instances for identityGovernance

/instances/$count.description: Provides operations to count the resources in the collection.

get.summary: Get the number of the resource

/instances/filterByCurrentUser(on='{on}'.description: Provides operations to call the filterByCurrentUser method.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}.description: Provides operations to manage the instances property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewScheduleDefinition entity.

get.description: If the accessReviewScheduleDefinition is a recurring access review, instances represent each recurrence. A review that does not recur will have exactly one instance. Instances also represent each unique resource under review in the accessReviewScheduleDefinition. If a review has multiple resources and multiple instances, each resource will have a unique instance for each recurrence.

delete.summary: Delete navigation property instances for identityGovernance

patch.summary: Update the navigation property instances in identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/acc.description: Provides operations to call the acceptRecommendations method.

post.description: Allows the acceptance of recommendations on all accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem objects that have not been reviewed on an accessReviewInstance object for which the calling user is a reviewer.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/app.description: Provides operations to call the applyDecisions method.

post.description: Apply review decisions on an accessReviewInstance if the decisions were not applied automatically because the autoApplyDecisionsEnabled property is `false` in the review's accessReviewScheduleSettings. The status of the accessReviewInstance must be `Completed` to call this method.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/bat.description: Provides operations to call the batchRecordDecisions method.

post.description: Enables reviewers to review all accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem objects in batches by using **principalId**, **resourceId**, or neither.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/con.description: Provides operations to manage the contactedReviewers property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: Get the reviewers for an access review instance, irrespective of whether or not they have received a notification. The reviewers are represented by an accessReviewReviewer object. A list of zero or more objects are returned, including all of their nested properties.

post.summary: Create new navigation property to contactedReviewers for identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/con.description: Provides operations to count the resources in the collection.

get.summary: Get the number of the resource

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/con.description: Provides operations to manage the contactedReviewers property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: Returns the collection of reviewers who were contacted to complete this review. While the reviewers and fallbackReviewers properties of the accessReviewScheduleDefinition might specify group owners or managers as reviewers, contactedReviewers returns their individual identities. Supports $select. Read-only.

delete.summary: Delete navigation property contactedReviewers for identityGovernance

patch.summary: Update the navigation property contactedReviewers in identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/dec.description: Provides operations to manage the decisions property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: Get the accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem resources from the decisions navigation property on a given accessReviewInstance. A list of zero or more accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem objects are returned, including all of their nested properties.

post.summary: Create new navigation property to decisions for identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/dec.description: Provides operations to count the resources in the collection.

get.summary: Get the number of the resource

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/dec.description: Provides operations to call the filterByCurrentUser method.
Provides operations to manage the decisions property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: Each user reviewed in an accessReviewInstance has a decision item representing if they were approved, denied, or not yet reviewed.

delete.summary: Delete navigation property decisions for identityGovernance

patch.summary: Update the navigation property decisions in identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/res.description: Provides operations to call the resetDecisions method.

post.description: Resets all accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem objects on an accessReviewInstance to `notReviewed`.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sen.description: Provides operations to call the sendReminder method.

post.description: Send a reminder to the reviewers of an active accessReviewInstance.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to manage the stages property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: Retrieve the stages in a multi-stage access review instance.

post.summary: Create new navigation property to stages for identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to count the resources in the collection.

get.summary: Get the number of the resource

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to call the filterByCurrentUser method.
Provides operations to manage the stages property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewInstance entity.

get.description: If the instance has multiple stages, this returns the collection of stages. A new stage will only be created when the previous stage ends. The existence, number, and settings of stages on a review instance are created based on the accessReviewStageSettings on the parent accessReviewScheduleDefinition.

delete.summary: Delete navigation property stages for identityGovernance

patch.summary: Update the navigation property stages in identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to manage the decisions property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewStage entity.

get.summary: List decisions (from a multi-stage access review)
get.description: Get the decisions from a stage in a multi-stage access review. The decisions in an accessReviewStage object are represented by an accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem object.

post.summary: Create new navigation property to decisions for identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to count the resources in the collection.

get.summary: Get the number of the resource

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to call the filterByCurrentUser method.
Provides operations to manage the decisions property of the microsoft.graph.accessReviewStage entity.

get.description: Each user reviewed in an accessReviewStage has a decision item representing if they were approved, denied, or not yet reviewed.

delete.summary: Delete navigation property decisions for identityGovernance

patch.summary: Update the navigation property decisions in identityGovernance

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sta.description: Provides operations to call the stop method.

post.description: Stop an access review stage that is `inProgress`. After the access review stage stops, the stage **status** will be `Completed` and the reviewers can no longer give input. If there are subsequent stages that depend on the completed stage, the next stage will be created.  The accessReviewInstanceDecisionItem objects will always reflect the last decisions recorded across all stages at that given time, regardless of the status of the stages.

/instances/{accessReviewInstance-id}/sto.description: Provides operations to call the stop method.

post.description: Stop a currently active accessReviewInstance. After the access review instance stops, the instance status is marked as `Completed`, the reviewers can no longer give input, and the access review decisions are applied. Stopping an instance will not stop future instances. To prevent a recurring access review from starting future instances, update the schedule definition to change its scheduled end date.
